task_summary: The robot pours the contents from a cup into a mug by approaching, aligning, pouring, and retreating.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic arm equipped with a gripper, holding a cup, and executing a pour into a mug placed on a table. The robot first locates the mug, approaches and aligns the cup above it, pours by tilting the cup, and then retreats. The workspace is uncluttered with clear visibility of both objects. The sequence ensures proper perception before actuation, precise alignment, controlled pouring, and safe retreat after completion.
preconditions: Robot holds the cup containing liquid
Mug is positioned on the table in workspace
stepwise_plan: If not visible, run object detection for the mug
Approach and align above the mug
Pour from the cup into the mug with a 90-degree tilt
success_criteria: Cup is emptied (or partially emptied) into the mug
No spillage; pouring occurs over the mug
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect mug: retry detection
Approach misalignment: abort pour or re-align
Pour failed: possible repeat or abort
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after retreating from the mug area post-pour.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is currently visible to the perception system.
Runs the perception pipeline to detect the mug if not currently visible.
Moves the end effector (with held cup) to a position above or near the mug in preparation for pouring.
Executes the pouring action from the cup into the mug with a full 90-degree tilt.
Retracts the end effector to a safe distance from the mug after pouring.

failure_modes: Pour fails due to misalignment or obstruction
recovery_strategy: Retry detection if mug not visible
Abort or re-align if approach failed
Optional repeat or abort on pour failure
assumptions: No explicit force, pour_rate, or amount parameters are visually inferable; defaults set to null.
The cup is manipulated by the robot throughout, consistent with the frames.
Sequence strictly follows observed order in frames; instruction omits source but frames show a cup.
Action node ports matched as closely as permitted by visual evidence and port value space bins.

expected_success_criteria: Cup contents transferred cleanly into the mug
Robot arm safely retracts after pouring
